subject: Re: [JUnit] Running JUnit from "main" method
msgSnippet: Which suite() are you planning to run?! Your code below is ignoring the test case specified by the command line. Likely you either have CLASSPATH problems or
messageBody:
Which suite() are you planning to run?! Your code below is ignoring the
test case specified by the command line. Likely you either have CLASSPATH
problems or your suite() method is wrong. There is no magic to this test
framework: drive the test runner as though you were invoking it from the
command line.

p s v main(String[] args) {
junit.textui.TestRunner.main(args);
}

I find it better simply to run the test runner directly, passing it the
name of the test case. (Either from the command line or from within your
IDE of choice.) Adding the same code to every test case class for the sake
of being able to invoke the test case class rather than the test runner
doesn't appear to pay off.

Good luck.

J. B. Rainsberger <rainsber@...>

To: junit@yahoogroups.com
cc:
Subject: [JUnit] Running JUnit from "main" method



Someone pleeeease HELP. When I compile a code with these few lines :
public static void main(String[] args) {
junit.textui.TestRunner.run(suite());
}
}
it gets compiled perfectly fine. But when I give: java <testcase name>
JUnit gives the following error.
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: HelloWorldTest
(wrong name: junit/samples/money/HelloWorldTest).
I simply can't figure out why.

Also somebody let me know how apply JUnit to swings & servlets.

Deepa A
